page.title: 20SW BASINGSTOKE: HISTORY
page.content: Just south of Kempshott there is an archeological dig of the old village of{Hatch.}Aerial photographs showed marks of Iron Age fields. From October 1984 to April 1985 they have been digging. They have also found an abandoned Medieval village of late 12th to 14th century. It may have been left because many people died from the plague. A church and a cemetary have been found with about forty graves, including one of a priest who was buried with a pewter chalice. They have found some Roman/British pottery but they are not sure if people have lived there continuously from the Iron Age to the 14th century. They are busy recording all their findings from Summer 1985 and hope to continue excavating the Iron Age remains after the harvest.
